Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of vandalism during the Bharat bandh by farmers by using the image of vegetables scattered on the road as evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that vegetables were thrown on the streets during the Bharat bandh.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image of vegetables scattered on the road is a result of vandalism during the Bharat bandh, without considering alternative explanations or verifying the authenticity of the image.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Congress media panelist Surendra Rajput, who claimed that the photograph was taken during the coronavirus lockdown when incidents of violence against fruit and vegetable vendors were reported.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the same image was used on May 5, 2020, before the Bharat bandh, suggesting that it may not be directly related to the protest.
